meanings.sent1: She would kvetch about the rainy weather every day.
meanings.sent2: Please don't kvetch about the long line; we'll get through it.
meanings.sent3: Even the birds seemed to kvetch about the early morning wake-up call.
meanings.sent4: The old car would kvetch with every bump in the road.
meanings.sent5: His constant kvetching made everyone around him feel tired.
meanings.sent6: Despite her tendency to kvetch, she always had a smile on her face.

meanings.sent1: He's such a kvetch; nothing ever seems to make him happy.
meanings.sent2: The office kvetch always finds something to grumble about.
meanings.sent3: The little kvetch in the corner kept muttering about the food.
meanings.sent4: She was a kvetch in a world full of sunshine and rainbows.
meanings.sent5: The kvetch at the party brought down the mood with their constant complaints.
